Bill de hOra wrote:
>> The thing to bear in mind is the Feedburner API design 
>> falls naturally out of HTML forms. I'm utterly convinced 
>> HTML forms is the most damaging Web technology 
>> standard ever conceived - it demands. Nothing else is 
>> remotely close. It's confused maybe half a dozen web 
>> technologies (cgi, browsers, SOAP/WS, xml-rpc, 
>> web-mvc, Web2.0 apis). It coerces developers to the 
>> do the wrong thing; either with apps or framework designs.

Had you, with a clean slate and knowning what you know today, been given the
privledge of designing the functionalty that HTML forms provides, how would
you have designed them/what would you have done differently?  In addition,
given legacy constraints, what would you do to fix them if you were to write
the spec?
